sub_topic: The measurement of the top quark mass
message_1: What is the numeric value of the top quark mass in GeV/c² as measured in proton-antiproton collisions at a center-of-mass energy of 1.96 TeV by the DZero experiment at the Fermilab Tevatron collider?
message_2: The numeric value of the top quark mass in GeV/c² as measured in proton-antiproton collisions at a center-of-mass energy of 1.96 TeV by the DZero experiment at the Fermilab Tevatron collider is approximately 173.3 GeV/c². This value is based on the combined analysis of various decay channels and has an uncertainty of around 1.1 GeV/c².
